StringAttributeValue.Value: Denotes where responsibility of a task or deliverable has not yet been decided

Issues.Name: Open-Plan Dining Areas

Documents.Name: Contribute to development of Initial Project Brief including Project Objectives, Quality Objectives, Project Outcomes, Sustainability Aspirations, Project Budget and other parameters or constraints.
Documents.Description: The Initial Project Brief is prepared following discussions with the Client to ascertain the Project Objectives, the Clients Business Case and, in certain instances, in response to site Feasibility Studies.

Issues.Name: 1.010 Contribute to development of Initial Project Brief including Project Objectives, Quality Objectives, Project Outcomes, Sustainability Aspirations, Project Budget and other parameters or constraints.

Documents.Name: Provide information for and contribute to contents of Project Execution Plan as required.
Documents.Description: The Project Execution Plan is produced in collaboration between the Project Lead and Lead Designer, with contributions from other designers and members of the project team. The Project Execution Plan sets out the processes and protocols to be used to develop the design. It is sometimes referred to as a project quality plan.

Issues.Name: 1.020 Provide information for and contribute to contents of Project Execution Plan as required.

Documents.Name: Develop Initial Project Brief with project team including Project Objectives, Quality Objectives, Project Outcomes, Sustainability Aspirations, Project Budget and other parameters or constraints.
Documents.Description: The Initial Project Brief is prepared following discussions with the Client to ascertain the Project Objectives, the Clients Business Case and, in certain instances, in response to site Feasibility Studies.

Issues.Name: 1.030 Develop Initial Project Brief with project team including Project Objectives, Quality Objectives, Project Outcomes, Sustainability Aspirations, Project Budget and other parameters or constraints.

Documents.Name: Collate comments and facilitate workshops as required to develop Initial Project Brief
Documents.Description: All members of the Project Team will have an input, but one member takes responsibilty for organising the process and coordinating the results.

Issues.Name: 1.040 Collate comments and facilitate workshops as required to develop Initial Project Brief

Documents.Name: Prepare Project Roles Table and Contractual Tree and continue assembling and appointing project team members.
Documents.Description: The Project Team must be appropriate to the nature and scale of the project, and the agreed method of delivery of the Core Objectives.

Issues.Name: 1.050 Prepare Project Roles Table and Contractual Tree and continue assembling and appointing project team members.

Documents.Name: Prepare Schedule of Services and develop Design Responsibility Matrix including Information Exchanges with Lead designer.
Documents.Description: All members of the Project Team will have an input, but one member takes responsibilty for organising the process and coordinating the results.

Issues.Name: 1.060 Prepare Schedule of Services and develop Design Responsibility Matrix including Information Exchanges with Lead designer.

Documents.Name: Review Project Programme and Feasibility Studies.
Documents.Description: All members of the Project Team will have an input, but one member takes responsibilty for organising the process and coordinating the results.

Issues.Name: 1.070 Review Project Programme and Feasibility Studies.

Documents.Name: Prepare Risk Assessments.
Documents.Description: The Risk Assessment considers the various design and other risks on a project and how each risk will be managed and the party responsible for managing each risk.

Issues.Name: 1.080 Prepare Risk Assessments.

Documents.Name: Prepare Project Execution Plan.
Documents.Description: The Project Execution Plan is produced in collaboration between the project lead and lead designer, with contributions from other designers and members of the project team. The Project Execution Plan sets out the processes and protocols to be used to develop the design. It is sometimes referred to as a project quality plan.

Issues.Name: 1.090 Prepare Project Execution Plan.

Documents.Name: Prepare Handover Strategy.
Documents.Description: The strategy for handing over a building, including the requirements for phased handovers, commissioning, training of staff or other factors crucial to the successful occupation of a building. On some projects, the Building Services Research and Information Association (BSRIA) Soft Landings process is used as the basis for formulating the strategy and undertaking a Post-occupancy Evaluation (www.bsria.co.uk/services/design/soft-landings/)

Issues.Name: 1.100 Prepare Handover Strategy.

Documents.Name: Monitor and review progress and performance of project team.
Documents.Description: This will be carried out and measured against agreed targets.

Issues.Name: 1.110 Monitor and review progress and performance of project team.

Documents.Name: Provide information for and contribute to contents of Project Execution Plan as required.
Documents.Description: All members of the Project Team will have an input, but one member takes responsibilty for organising the process and coordinating the results.

Documents.Name: Undertake Feasibility Studies.
Documents.Description: Studies undertaken on a given site to test the feasibility of the Initial Project Brief on a specific site or in a specific context and to consider how site-wide issues will be addressed.
